definition: unpredictable eventuality/unpreventable/unavoidable/impossible to overcome/nothing can be done about it/act of God/force majeure
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: If a contract is unable to be performed due to force majeure, the provisions of the preceding two paragraphs shall not apply.
sentences.chinese: 因不可抗力不能履行合同的，不适用前两款规定。

sentences.english: The great damage to property has been caused by the force majeure.
sentences.chinese: 财产的严重损害是由不可抗力事由造成的。

sentences.english: You might call it an act of God.
sentences.chinese: 你也许会将其称为一种不可抗力。

sentences.english: The preceding two paragraphs shall not apply if the non-performance of the contract was due to force majeure.
sentences.chinese: 因不可抗力不能履行合同的，不适用前两款规定。

sentences.english: However, damage caused by disasters, wars or force majeure is not included.
sentences.chinese: 但天灾或事变战争或不可抗力者，均不在此限。

definition: to break a promise/to violate an agreement/to default (on a loan or contract)
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
to reschedule/to rearrange (e.g. a meeting)/to postpone
second party (law)/see also 甲方[jia3 fang1]
to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup
to stop work/to shut down/to stop production
